PayWell is a digital service platform that provides a variety of payment services, including mobile recharge, utility bills, visa fees, bus tickets, air tickets, education and entertainment content subscription fees. PayWell follows standard distribution architecture, where layers of channel partners like distributors and retailers are involved in its value chain. \n\nWe are located at: \nSkill House(L-7)\nKA-53/2, Shahjadpur, \nGulshan, Dhaka-1212. \nPhone: 096663333, 09610116566, 09638016566\nEmail: contact@cloudwell.co\nWebsite: https://www.paywellonline.com/

How do I login to the new app version for the first time?
What is a registered mobile number?
What is OTP?
If I do not get the OTP number?
How do I login next time to the new app version of PayWell?
What is PayWell email address?
Click the login option to log in. Then enter your mobile number used in PayWell and enter your PIN number and click on the login option. 4 digit OTP number will be sent to your registered mobile number. Enter the OTP number in the right place and click on the “Next” option. When the OTP verification is complete, click on the “OK” option.
The mobile number used while registering at PayWell is your registered mobile number.
When you login for the first time, A 4 digit OTP (One Time Password) number will be sent to your registered mobile number.
If you do not get the OTP number, click the Resend OTP option.
Login with registered mobile number and PIN number.

1. What is PayWell?
2. How can I use PayWell service?
3. How can I register with PayWell as a retailer?
4. Can I open a PayWell account without a valid trade license?
5. Can I use someone else\'s trade license to open a PayWell account?
6. How do I transfer my PayWell account to another person?
7. Is there any charge for PayWell registration?
8. If I want to use PayWell service on web version?
9. What can I do now after registration, it\'s showing your request is "Pending"?
10. How do I cancel the registration?
11. What to do to change the mobile?
PayWell acts as a one-stop solution for various payments through a large network of outlets, providing users the most convenient, fastest secured platform. Customers can easily recharge all mobile operators and brilliant numbers, can pay Palli Bidyut, DESO, DPDC, Dhaka WASA, Karnafuli Gas , Internet Bill can purchase Bus, Launch and Air Ticket , BBC Windows and Bongo Pakage, payment of Indian visa fee and difference services as well.
Android app, Web portal & POS machine.
Retailers must have physical outlet/valid trade license, National ID Card and basic understanding of app/device usage. Business types include but are not limited to convenience stores, pharmacies, super-stores, grocery stores, telecom servicing centers, bookshops, photocopy stations, electronic stores and cyber cafés. If want to be an agent of PayWell, you can download PayWell Services app from Google Play Store in your android device and fill up registration form and upload required documents. Upon approval by our verification team, you will get PIN number and can access to PayWell services. If you want to use other means i.e. POS terminal, computer or web panel, please contact our helpdesk 096667773333, 09638016566 for know about manual registration process.
No, If you do not have a trade license, you will not be able to open any account to start any business with PayWell.
We recommend using your own trade license.
For the POS machine, contact your nearest dealer/collection officer with 1 copy passport size photo of the new agent, NID photo, photo of trade licensee, and clear photo with signboard/banner from outside the outlet. In the case of the Mobile App and Web Portal, we recommend to open a new account.
There is no charge for registration at PayWell.
You need to email us your details information. salesops@cloudwell.co or helpdesk@cloudwell.co, including 1 copy of your passport size photo, NID photo (both directions), photo of the trade license and outlet image, to open a PayWell webportal access for your computer.
All the information of the agent will verifying from the PayWell head office so your request is showing "Pending". After 1 hour if the text "Pending" then contacts us 096101-16566, 096380-16566, 16566 helpline.
To cancel the registration, contact us on 096101-16566, 096380-16566, 16566 helpline.
Sir, contact us to relaunch the PayWell app on the new mobile.
1. How can I get balance to sell PayWell services?
2. Do I need to have separate balance for each service?
3. From which banks can I refill the balance at PayWell?
4 Can I refill the PayWell balance from bKash?
5. How do I refill the PayWell balance from Nagad?
6. How do I claim the balance from Nagad to PayWell?
7. What is the charge of balance refill from Nagad?
8. Balance showing zero (0). What to do about it?
9. PayWell balance mismatch what can I do now?
10. What do I do to get my monthly transaction report?
You can easily refill PayWell balance in 3 ways lift from our local distributor, deposit to any of our designated banks and can also refill balance through Nagad payments.
No. You can sell any services from single PayWell balance.
You can refill the balance at PayWell from BRAC Bank, Dutch Bangla Bank, Islamic Bank Bangladesh Limited, Pubali Bank, Standard Chartered Bank and The City Bank.
Currently this service is not available.
Select the Direct Balance Refill option. Enter the amount of money and "Confirm". Give the PayWell PIN number. Select “I agree to the terms and conditions” with your Nagad account number and proceed. “Proceed” with the “OTP” number sent via SMS from Nagad to your mobile. Give the Nagad PIN number. PayWell balance will be added immediately.
For balance, go to the balance claim option of PayWell app and complete the claim process with your cash account number / transaction ID and amount of money. (1.2% service charge applicable). If the balance is not added within 5 minutes, call the PayWell Help Desk. \nNote: The PayWell Authority does not bear the responsibility if the balance is not added due to error of 11 digit mobile number or RID. Please be careful when making any payments.
1.2 service charge is applicable.
If PayWell does not recognize your POS properly, your balance may show zero. If there is a problem in the registration of your POS, such a problem may occur. In that case, wait a while and try again. For “web portal” close your computer\\\'s browser completely, clear the browser history and start a new web portal page. In the case of a mobile app, login again.
Please contact us at 096101-16566, 096380-16566, 16566 helpline. In 24 to 48 hours you will be given a detailed statement of the specified time period.
Please contact us on 096101-16566, 096380-16566, 16566 helpline.
1. What to do if I get the message "Internet Connection Error" when trying to top up?
2. What do I do if I see “Time limit Error” when topup a number?
3. What do I do if I get the status “Invalid Topup Value”?
4. What do I do if I get “Authentication Error” when topup?
5. What do I do if it shows “Technical Error” when topup?
6. Repeatedly showing “Can Not Be Processed” when topup?
7. What do I do if topup shows an error message?
8. What to do if topup shows "Successful" response but customer did not get the balance?
This message shows if you have trouble getting internet in POS. If you get “Internet Connection Error” message, wait for 45 seconds before making the next transaction. Even then, if the problem is not solved, open the battery of the POS machine, open the SIM card and try to put it again, because if the SIM card is displaced, the POS will not get internet connection.
Once you have successfully topped any Grameenphone, Skitt, Banglalink, Teletalk, Airtel or Robi number, you will not be able to topup the same amount within next 5 minutes for the next 05 minutes.
Minimum 10 taka for “Prepaid” Number and minimum 50 taka for “Postpaid” Number can be topup. You can\'t topup any number above 1000 taka at once. If you give any amount outside this, this status will show.
This error is usually shown by giving wrong PIN number.
This status can be due to two reasons - the number you want to topup if you get this error from the operator or the Internet connection of the POS is disconnected during the transaction. In both cases you have to go to "Inquire Topup" and check the transaction. \n In the case of the first reason, you will see "Technical Error" in the Status of the transaction in response to the search, this is a technical problem received from the operator. There is no possibility of cutting your balance for this. In the case of the second reason, sometimes the transaction is successful. This is because, even though your request from POS reaches our server during the transaction, the POS internet connection is disconnected before it can be answered, which shows the error. In this case, there is no need to repeat Topup.
This status is given by the operator (eg: Grameenphone, Banglalink, Robi, Airtel, Teletalk). In this case, after waiting for a while, you can request Topup again at number.
Usually, the answer to your request comes within 45 seconds through Sending, Receiving and Connecting. If there is no response after 45 seconds, first check your internet connection, if the internet connection is OK, then wait 3-5 minutes and call Customer Care to report your problem. If you exit the menu without any error, go to "Inquire Topup" and search for the topup to see if the topup is done.
You will be informed of the details of Topup within 24 to 48 hours subject to the appropriate evidence obtained by contacting the concerned operator from PayWell. In that case, if the topup is done, the customer\'s complaint will not be accepted and the retailer will not get any refund. If Topup has failed due to any kind of problem then the same amount of Topup will be refunded in the retailer balance. Just go to “Inquire Topup” and search for Topup and if you show “fail” then you can request to send the recharge again
1. How can I get Palli Bidyut bill payment service?
2. How do I get a stamped copy of the contract?
3. Is it possible to pay Palli Bidyut bill from anywhere in Bangladesh?
4. What do I do if shows "to be processed" when I trying to pay the Palli Bidyut bill payment?
5. What do I do if it shows "Canceled due to duplicate" request when I trying to pay the Palli Bidyut bill payment?
6. What do I do when I trying to pay the Palli Bidyut bill payment, the bill shows not processed?
7. What do I do if I see the wrong bill number when I go to pay the Palli Bidyut bill?
8. I paid the Palli Bidyut bill, after checking the Inquiry check - TBPS Response Error, what should I do?
9. What do I do if Palli Bidyut bill not paid (Update)?
10. Which number should I use when paying Palli Bidyut bill, SMS bill number or SMS account number?
11. Showing "Invalid Bill Number" while paying Palli Bidyut bill?
12. What to do to upload Palli Bidyut bill?
13. Showing "Service not rendered" while paying Palli Bidyut bill?
14. Is it possible to pay Palli Bidyut pre-paid bill?
You can get Palli Bidyut bill payment service by signing a contract with us. After the contract reaches us, the Palli Bidyut service will be active in your app.
If a copy of the stamp is emailed to you, you will fill it with your signature and if you email us a scanned copy of the stamp, we will start the rural electricity service. The original copy of the stamp has to be couriered to our place.
Yes. You can pay Palli Bidyut bill from anywhere in Bangladesh.
Wait a while and try again. You tried to pay the bill again before your first attempt to pay the bill was successful or unsuccessful, or while it was in the process. In that case, wait for 3-5 minutes and try to clear the bill again.
You are trying to pay the same bill again and again. Or your bill has not been updated at the Palli Bidyut office. If the bill has not been updated, please contact our call center. We will take steps to update your bill.
Please try again later.
You are giving the wrong bill number.
Try again after a while.
Give us your bill number. We are trying to resolve your issue by contacting Palli Bidyut.
Dear Agent, for your information, Dhaka-1/3/4, Gazipur-1, Narayanganj-1, Jessore-1, Bhola, Sunamganj, Tangail, Mymensingh-1, Barisal-2, Sylhet-1, Jhenaidah , Faridpur, Brahmanbaria and Cox\'s Bazar-Palli biddut Samiti bill have to be paid with SMS account number.\n Note: In case of bills other than the mentioned Palli biddut Samiti, the bill has to be paid with SMS bill number.
If you show "Invalid Bill Number" while paying Palli Bidyut bill, please contact us on 096101-16566, 096380-16566, 16566 helpline.
For uploading Palli Bidyut bill, contact us on 096101-16566, 096380-16566, 16566 helpline.
If you show "Service not rendered" while paying the rural electricity bill, it means that your rural electricity service is not running. Contact us 096101-16566, 096380-16566, 16566 helpline to start the rural electricity service.
Currently this service in not available.
1. Is it possible to pay DESCO pre-paid bill?
2. Is it possible to pay DESCO due bill?
3. Which number should I give while paying DPDC bill?
4. Which number should I give while paying WASA bill?
Yes, You can payment DESCO pre-paid bill.
Yes.
Use the bill copy “Customer No”.
Use the bill copy “Bill No”.
1. How do I register for MyCash service?
2.I live outside Dhaka. How do I register My Cash from outside Dhaka?
3. What are the benefits of MyCash service?
4. How many transactions can I see from the mini statement?
5. What is OTP?
6. OTP validity period?
7. What do I do when the OTP expires?
To register MyCash, you will become an agent of MyCash by submitting 2 copies of passport size photo (lab print) of the agent, photocopy of trade license, copy of NID and 1 copy photo of the nominee (lab print) and NID. Become an agent of MyCash after verifying all your information. Contact us for registration form 096101-16566, 096380-16566, 16566 helpline. \n Note: Grameenphone and Teletalk mobile numbers cannot be used during registration in Mycash.
Contact us for registration 096101-1858, 097360-1656, 1858 Help Line.
You can cash in / out through MyCash
The last 5.
OTP (one time password) is a 6 digit security code. This code will be required for each payment.
7 days
Set the OTP again
1.What are the bus and launch ticket service charges and commissions?
2. What are the bus and launch ticket cancellation service charges and commissions?
3. How much is the air ticket commission?
The customer has to pay 20 (twenty) taka service charge for each ticket. The retailer will get 10 (ten) taka commission for each ticket.
The customer has to pay 20 (twenty) taka service charge for each ticket cancellation. The retailer will get 10 (ten) taka commission for each ticket.
The commission on air tickets is 5% of base fare.
